DERBY-4275: Query executions fail when compressing a table using SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_COMPRESS_TABLE
backported changes #1142583 and #1160597 from trunk to 10.3 branch.
Move invalidation of dependent statements until the system tables have been updated with information about the new conglomerates created by compression or truncation. This is to prevent that statements executing concurrently get recompiled too early and don't see the new conglomerates (and therefore fail on subsequent executions because they cannot find the old conglomerates).
Fail in a controlled fashion (StandardException) if the conglomerate disappears while binding the FromBaseTable. This used to cause a NullPointerException.
Did not backport the changes to TruncateTableTest. Truncate table functionality was released in 10.7, so changes did not apply to 10.5.
Had to hand backport the CompressTableTest, removing tests for fixes not in 10.3.
